title: Normal Distribution
content:
# Normal Distribution

The most important distribution in statistics. Many natural phenomena follow a normal distribution.

## Characteristics

*   Symmetric bell shape.
*   Mean = Median = Mode.
*   Defined by Mean ($\mu$) and Standard Deviation ($\sigma$).

## Empirical Rule (68-95-99.7)

*   68% of data falls within $\mu \pm 1\sigma$
*   95% of data falls within $\mu \pm 2\sigma$
*   99.7% of data falls within $\mu \pm 3\sigma$

## Standard Normal Distribution (Z)

A normal distribution with $\mu=0$ and $\sigma=1$.

$$Z = \frac{X - \mu}{\sigma}$$

## Generating Normal Data

```python
import numpy as np
# Mean=0, Std=1, 1000 samples
data = np.random.randn(1000)
# or
data = np.random.normal(loc=0, scale=1, size=1000)
```
code:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
